_preValidatePurchase(address,uint256).details: Validation of an incoming purchase. Use require statements to revert state when conditions are not met. Use `super` in contracts that inherit from Crowdsale to extend their validations. Example from CappedCrowdsale.sol's _preValidatePurchase method:     super._preValidatePurchase(beneficiary, weiAmount);     require(weiRaised().add(weiAmount) <= cap);

params.weiAmount: Value in wei involved in the purchase

buyTokens(address).details: low level token purchase ***DO NOT OVERRIDE*** This function has a non-reentrancy guard, so it shouldn't be called by another `nonReentrant` function.

returns._0: the number of token units a buyer gets per wei.
the address where funds are collected.
